node.title: Russia declines to hold U.N. vote on its Ukraine resolution after pushback
node.description: At a Security Council meeting, the U.S. said, "President Putin: Stop the killings. Withdraw your forces. Leave Ukraine once and for all."

node.title: Thirty-one whales dead after Farewell Spit stranding
node.description: Rescuers are working to refloat five pilot whales at high tide on Farewell Spit after a mass stranding at the top of the South Island.

node.title: Samoa records first community case of Covid-19
node.description: Samoa has recorded its first case of community transmitted Covid-19 and the first stage of a national lockdown has begun.

node.title: Tairāwhiti Covid-19 increase could be 'a result of poverty in action' - GP
node.description: The region, which includes Gisborne and the East Cape, has the highest per capita rate of Covid-19 in the country.

node.title: Self-employed contractors can claim $13,200 over six weeks
node.description: It would mean a payment of $2200 a week for the self-employed contractors, which is nearly four times as much as the original $600 Covid Wage Subsidy.

node.title: At least 6 killed in massive crash involving 20 tractor trailers
node.description: Officials are still investigating the number of people injured.

node.title: MIQ hotels empty out as system winds down
node.description: Twenty-three hotels and thousands of managed isolation and quarantine (MIQ) rooms are now sitting empty across the country, as the system winds down.

node.title: Search for missing Tauranga man to focus on Pāpāmoa sand dunes
node.description: A large search for missing man David Holland through Pāpāmoa sand dunes will take place tomorrow.

node.title: How Ukrainians are using art to depict the realities of war
node.description: "It's like my voice to the war to talk about what's happening now in Ukraine," one illustrator told CBS News.

node.title: Former KGB spy offers insights on what Putin wants
node.description: "Afghanistan was the beginning of the end of the Soviet Union — and Ukraine may become the beginning of the end of Putin as a dictator," the former sleeper agent told CBS News.

node.title: Mariupol theatre: 'We knew something terrible would happen'
node.description: A woman who left Mariupol's theatre a day before the bombing says Russia had been targeting the building where hundreds of civilians had sought shelter from constant shelling.

node.title: Poll analysis: Americans less concerned as they face future of pandemic
node.description: Few say it's over, but Americans venture out.

node.title: Alleged Patriot Boys member pleads guilty to assaulting officer on Jan. 6
node.description: Lucas Denney's guilty plea came after the Justice Department admitted it had forgotten to formally indict him.

node.title: Kremlin furious over Biden calling Putin 'a war criminal'
node.description: The row comes as Russia strikes hit civilians, including a theatre turned shelter in Mariupol.

node.title: House votes to suspend trade relations with Russia and Belarus
node.description: Biden called for congressional action in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine last week.

node.title: 13-year-old was driving truck involved in crash that killed 9 in Texas, NTSB says
node.description: Six University of the Southwest students and one faculty member were killed.

node.title: Schwarzenegger speaks to Russians in emotional video about war
node.description: "I'm speaking to you today because there are things that are being kept from you," he said. "Terrible things that you should know about."

node.title: Droughts will continue, much of U.S. will see above-average temperatures, NOAA says
node.description: The NOAA said this spring's drought represents the largest the country has seen since 2013.

node.title: Prison release grant stuck at maximum of $350 for 30 years
node.description: If the Steps to Freedom grant had kept up with inflation, it would be about $700 today.

node.title: Ukrainians can be considered for asylum at U.S.-Mexico border, DHS says
node.description: The Biden administration instructed border officials to consider exempting Ukrainians from Title 42, a pandemic restriction that prevents other migrants from seeking asylum.

node.title: Could permanent daylight saving time "jump-start" the economy?
node.description: Transitioning to year-round DST is uniting Republicans and Democrats. But the economic benefits are murky.

node.title: Trump's EPA chief Scott Pruitt weighing Senate run in Oklahoma
node.description: Pruitt's tenure at the EPA under Trump was pockmarked by ethics scandals that lent the appearance of Pruitt trying to benefit personally from his office.

node.title: Tom Walsh out to maintain his golden run at World Champs
node.description: The New Zealand shot putter has an impressive record to maintain at the World Athletics Indoor Championships in Serbia this weekend and he's up for the challenge.

node.title: Māori leader Sir Wira Gardiner dies after illness
node.description: Prominent Māori leader Sir Wira Gardiner had been ill for a while, and stepped down as interim chief executive of Oranga Tamariki last year.

node.title: Thousands of northeast Japan homes still without power after earthquake kills four
node.description: Tens of thousands of Japanese households remained without power on Thursday morning, more than 10 hours after a powerful earthquake that left at least four dead and more than 100 injured.

node.title: Blinken confirms death of U.S. citizen in Ukraine
node.description: The secretary of state did not share any additional details.

node.title: Air NZ looks to land $1.3b in capital
node.description: Air New Zealand is on the verge of launching its long awaited billion dollar capital raising, according to Australian media reports.

node.title: 'Rotten families': Councillor lashes out over unsafe street
node.description: Two senior political leaders are frustrated over the lack of police and council action regarding violence in a Rotorua street.

node.title: Wellington water inquiry: Fluoride stopped in May last year
node.description: Wellington's water company has revealed it stopped adding fluoride to the water supply last year.

node.title: Bee colony deaths increase for seventh consecutive year - report
node.description: Bee colony deaths in Aotearoa have risen for the seventh year in a row, with a new reporting estimating nearly 14 percent of the country's beehives were lost over the 2021 winter.
